programme.title: The Super
programme.desc: Ordered to live among his tenants in squalor, a New York slumlord (Joe Pesci) does so and sees the light.

programme.title: Jeffrey
programme.desc: A 30-ish, gay New Yorker (Steven Weber) swears off sex, then falls for an HIV-positive guy (Michael T. Weiss) he meets at the gym.

programme.title: Unlawful Entry
programme.desc: A creepy policeman (Ray Liotta) gets close to a Los Angeles couple (Kurt Russell, Madeleine Stowe) in order to drive them apart.

programme.title: Hitman
programme.desc: A fast talker (Eric Tsang) engages a Hong Kong rube (Jet Li) to track down the assassin of a sleazy Japanese businessman.

programme.title: Merlin
programme.desc: The life and adventures of the magician, Merlin.

programme.title: Merlin
programme.desc: A medieval sorcerer pursues true love while battling evil, guiding King Arthur and seeking the Holy Grail.

programme.title: Living in Oblivion
programme.desc: A harried director must contend with technical foul-ups and actors' shenanigans on the set of a low-budget film.

programme.title: Bloodfist II
programme.desc: The world kickboxing champion (Don "The Dragon" Wilson) retreats to Manila, lands in a mess and fights his way out.

programme.title: The Final Sacrifice
programme.desc: A teenager's investigation into his father's death leads him to a hidden city populated with menacing warriors.

programme.title: Space Truckers
programme.desc: A freight pilot (Dennis Hopper), his girlfriend (Debi Mazar) and an apprentice (Stephen Dorff) try to deliver cargo to Earth in 2197.

programme.title: Glengarry Glen Ross
programme.desc: Underhanded real estate salesmen sink to varying levels of deceit in order to sell their dubious properties.

programme.title: The Lawnmower Man: Director's Cut
programme.desc: A scientist uses an intellectually disabled gardener as a guinea pig in his experiments with intelligence enhancing drugs and virtual reality. The man transforms into a genius, but not without side effects.

programme.title: Lawnmower Man 2: Beyond Cyberspace
programme.desc: An evil corporation planning an inescapable global computer network hires a mentally impaired laborer (Matt Frewer) made into a genius by virtual reality.
